title: North African Campaign Overview Map
description: Overview map showing the theater of operations from Egypt to Tunisia, including major supply routes, key ports, and the extent of Axis and Allied territorial control at various points.

title: Siege of Tobruk Map
description: Detailed map of Tobruk showing the defensive perimeter held by Australian and British forces during the 241-day siege. Includes German and Italian attack vectors and the Red Line defensive positions.

title: First Battle of El Alamein
description: Map showing the positions during the July 1942 battle where Auchinleck halted Rommel's advance on Alexandria and Cairo. Demonstrates the critical 'bottleneck' geography between the Mediterranean and the Qattara Depression.

title: Second Battle of El Alamein
description: Montgomery's Operation Lightfoot and Supercharge, October-November 1942. Shows the massive minefields, the break-in at Kidney Ridge, and the eventual breakthrough that sent Rommel into retreat.

title: Rommel's Advance to Egypt
description: Map tracking the Afrika Korps advance from El Agheila to El Alamein, January-July 1942. Shows the fall of Tobruk and the 'Gazala Gallop' that brought Rommel to the gates of Egypt.

title: SAS Raid Locations 1941-1943
description: Map showing the locations of major SAS and LRDG raids on Axis airfields and supply lines, including Stirling's famous attacks on Sidi Haneish, Benghazi harbor, and Tamet airfield.

title: Tunisia Campaign Map
description: The final phase of the North African war, November 1942-May 1943. Shows Operation Torch landings, Kasserine Pass, and the final encirclement of Axis forces in Tunisia.
credit: U.S. Army Center of Military History, Public domain

title: Mediterranean Supply Routes
description: Map showing the critical supply routes for both sides: the Axis route from Italy via Tripoli, and the Allied routes from Egypt and (after Torch) from Algeria. Demonstrates why logistics determined the desert war.
credit: Royal Navy Historical Branch, Public domain
